Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Tensile \Ten"sile\, a. [See {Tense}, a.] 1. Of or pertaining to extension; as, tensile strength. [1913 Webster]
2. Capable of extension; ductile; tensible. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]

tensile adj 1: of or relating to tension; "tensile stress"; "tensile pull" 2: capable of being shaped or bent or drawn out; "ductile copper"; "malleable metals such as gold"; "they soaked the leather to made it pliable"; "pliant molten glass"; "made of highly tensile steel alloy" [syn: {ductile}, {malleable}, {pliable}, {pliant}, {tractile}]
